fact_check_explanation_title: This is what the guidelines are for social distancing in parliament.
fact_check_explanation_summary: The guidance includes a maximum number of people in the chamber and remote voting.

fact_check_explanation_title: Photos of ministers together weren’t taken at a ‘Cobra’ meeting
fact_check_explanation_summary: Ministers attending a Cabinet meeting appear to be adhering to workplace Covid guidance.
Social media posts claim the government is trying to quietly change the rules on unlicensed vaccines, but they’ve missed the point.

fact_check_explanation_title: Punishment for breaking social distancing and possessing indecent images of children can vary
fact_check_explanation_summary: Fines for breaking ‘rule of six’ start at £50 if paid on time.

fact_check_explanation_title: Lots of people are getting confused over testing figures
fact_check_explanation_summary: Many people in media and politics are mistakenly comparing two different things.

fact_check_explanation_title: Angela Rayner’s testing numbers are not quite right
fact_check_explanation_summary: The numbers she used in PMQs measure different things, and cannot be compared.

fact_check_explanation_title: Data on how far people travel to get a Covid-19 test isn’t all that useful
fact_check_explanation_summary: There are some issues with the data released by the government.

fact_check_explanation_title: There’s no connection between new biometrics legislation and Covid-19 tests
fact_check_explanation_summary: This legislation is to do with biometric data that is of interest to national security

fact_check_explanation_title: What do social distancing laws say about ‘mingling’?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Updates to the coronavirus law and guidance place restrictions on certain gatherings.

fact_check_explanation_title: This viral post understates the risk of Covid-19 infection
fact_check_explanation_summary: It claims the risk of catching Covid-19 is 44 million to one. This is a misreading of the fact that daily infections were 44 per million in England, and have …

fact_check_explanation_title: Instagram post falsely claims there was a plane crash at Gatwick Airport
fact_check_explanation_summary: It used an edited picture of an Emirates aircraft above some houses.

fact_check_explanation_title: £1.5bn GDP boost from UK-Japan trade deal is not on top of existing EU-Japan deal benefits
fact_check_explanation_summary: The UK currently trades with Japan under an EU trade agreement. The economic benefits of the new UK-Japan deal are relative to having no agreement, not to trading under the …
